alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Atlantic Coastal Cape May; Cape May; Coastal Atlantic; Coastal Ocean; Ocean; Southeastern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 15 at 8:33PM EST until December 16 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Ocean, Atlantic, Cape May, Atlantic Coastal Cape May, Coastal Atlantic, Coastal Ocean and Southeastern Burlington. * WHEN...Until 5 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...At this level, flooding begins on the most vulnerable roads in coastal and bayside communities, and along inland tidal waterways. Some partial or full road closures are possible. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Atlantic Ocean at Atlantic City MLLW Categories - Minor 6.0 ft, Moderate 7.0 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 2.4 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 16/01 AM 6.4 1.8 3.3 Minor 16/12 PM 6.2 1.6 2.8 Minor 17/02 AM 4.9 0.3 1.6 None 17/01 PM 4.1 -0.5 0.8 None 18/03 AM 4.3 -0.3 0.7 None 18/02 PM 4.1 -0.5 0.8 None Great Egg Harbor Bay at Ocean City MLLW Categories - Minor 5.3 ft, Moderate 6.3 ft, Major 7.3 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.3 ft, Moderate 2.3 ft, Major 3.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 16/01 AM 6.1 2.1 3.2 Minor 16/01 PM 5.5 1.5 2.2 Minor 17/02 AM 4.3 0.3 1.1 None 17/02 PM 3.5 -0.5 0.3 None 18/03 AM 3.7 -0.3 0.2 None 18/03 PM 3.5 -0.5 0.3 None Cape May Harbor at Cape May MLLW Categories - Minor 6.2 ft, Moderate 7.2 ft, Major 8.2 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.1 ft, Moderate 2.1 ft, Major 3.1 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 16/01 AM 6.7 1.6 3.3 Minor 16/01 PM 6.2 1.1 2.3 Minor 17/02 AM 5.3 0.2 1.6 None 17/02 PM 4.6 -0.5 0.8 None 18/03 AM 4.6 -0.5 0.6 None 18/03 PM 4.4 -0.7 0.6 None Barnegat Bay at Barnegat Light MLLW Categories - Minor 3.5 ft, Moderate 4.5 ft, Major 5.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.0 ft, Moderate 2.0 ft, Major 3.0 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 16/01 AM 4.1 1.6 2.4 Minor 16/01 PM 4.1 1.6 2.2 Minor 17/01 AM 3.1 0.6 1.4 None 17/01 PM 2.3 -0.2 0.6 None 18/03 AM 2.2 -0.3 0.2 None 18/03 PM 2.0 -0.5 0.2 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
